content:
To be eligible to serve as a member of the Legislative Yuan in Taiwan, a person must:

1. Be a Taiwanese citizen
2. Be at least 23 years of age
3. Not have been deprived of political rights
4. Not have been declared bankrupt or subject to a custodianship order
5. Not have been convicted of a crime and sentenced to a fixed term imprisonment of more than six months or a suspended sentence of more than one year and have not yet completed the sentence or been pardoned or had their right to hold public office restored
6. Have lived in Taiwan for at least two years before the election
7. Have a basic education as stipulated by law
8. Have not been removed from office due to a violation of the Constitution or related laws. 

Additionally, candidates must also meet specific requirements based on their constituency, such as being a registered voter within the constituency they are running or being a member of a political party that meets certain criteria.
